definition: lit. a bird startled by the mere twang of a bow (idiom)/fig. sb who frightens easily, due to past experiences
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
surname Gong
a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
variant of 屌[diao3]/penis

sentences.english: The Fed seems to have been spooked, and wanted to stop the markets' fall (see article).
sentences.chinese: 美联储似乎像是惊弓之鸟，妄图阻止股市的下跌。

sentences.english: The surge in gold is a sign of how jittery investors have become.
sentences.chinese: 金价急升，显出投资者已是惊弓之鸟。

sentences.english: Now capitalism is in a funk in its heartlands.
sentences.chinese: 现在资本主义的国家有如惊弓之鸟。

sentences.english: Puma bow-string such as iron, said he was also cant afford it.
sentences.chinese: 铁彪如惊弓之鸟，说自己实在还不起。
他们已经成了惊弓之鸟。

definition: lit. every tree or bush an enemy soldier (idiom); fig. to panic and treat everyone as an enemy/to feel beleaguered
lit. to see a bow reflected in a cup as a snake (idiom); fig. unnecessary suspicions/overly fearful
to be scared out of one's wits/to scare stiff
anxious/panicky
sb or sth detested by all/target of scorn/anathema/cf. 老鼠過街，人人喊打|老鼠过街，人人喊打[lao3 shu3 guo4 jie1 , ren2 ren2 han3 da3]
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
stray dog (idiom)
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
lit. like a turtle in a jar/to be trapped (idiom)
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
panic-stricken (idiom)/to be in a flustered state/also written 張惶失措|张惶失措[zhang1 huang2 shi1 cuo4]
convulsed with fear (idiom)
lit. body and soul separated (idiom); fig. scared out of one's wits/beside oneself
(idiom) to become agitated/to get worked up
alarmed/anxious
out of one's wits (idiom)/distracted/stunned
